Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Topology

/--
If a convex polygon $L$ is contained entirely within a square of side length $1$, prove that the sum of the squares of the side lengths of $L$ is no greater than $4$.
-/
theorem putnam_1966_b1
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n ≥ 3)
(L : ZMod n → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hsq : ∀ i : ZMod n, L i 0 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 ∧ L i 1 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1)
(hnoncol : ∀ i j k : ZMod n, i ≠ j ∧ j ≠ k ∧ k ≠ i → ¬Collinear ℝ {L i, L j, L k})
(hconvex : ∀ i : ZMod n, segment ℝ (L i) (L (i + 1)) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L j | j : ZMod n}) = ∅)
: ∑ i : Fin n, (dist (L i) (L (i + 1)))^2 ≤ 4 :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_b1
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n ≥ 3)
(L : ZMod n → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hsq : ∀ i : ZMod n, L i 0 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 ∧ L i 1 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1)
(hnoncol : ∀ i j k : ZMod n, i ≠ j ∧ j ≠ k ∧ k ≠ i → ¬Collinear ℝ {L i, L j, L k})
(hconvex : ∀ i : ZMod n, segment ℝ (L i) (L (i + 1)) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L j | j : ZMod n}) = ∅)
: ∑ i : Fin n, (dist (L i) (L (i + 1)))^2 ≤ 4 := by
  have h₁ := hnoncol 0 1 2
  have h₂ := hnoncol 0 2 1
  have h₃ := hnoncol 1 0 2
  have h₄ := hnoncol 1 2 0
  have h₅ := hnoncol 2 0 1
  have h₆ := hnoncol 2 1 0
  simp at h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆
  norm_num at h₁ h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆
  <;>
  aesop
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_b1
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n ≥ 3)
(L : ZMod n → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hsq : ∀ i : ZMod n, L i 0 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 ∧ L i 1 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1)
(hnoncol : ∀ i j k : ZMod n, i ≠ j ∧ j ≠ k ∧ k ≠ i → ¬Collinear ℝ {L i, L j, L k})
(hconvex : ∀ i : ZMod n, segment ℝ (L i) (L (i + 1)) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L j | j : ZMod n}) = ∅)
: ∑ i : Fin n, (dist (L i) (L (i + 1)))^2 ≤ 4 := by
  have h₁ := hnoncol 0 1 2
  have h₂ := hnoncol 0 2 1
  have h₃ := hconvex 0
  have h₄ := hconvex 1
  have h₅ := hconvex 2
  have h₆ := hsq 0
  have h₇ := hsq 1
  have h₈ := hsq 2
  simp_all [Fin.sum_univ_succ, Fin.sum_univ_zero, EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, collinear_iff_of_mem_Icc]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> nlinarith [sq_nonneg (L 0 0 - L 1 0), sq_nonneg (L 0 1 - L 1 1), sq_nonneg (L 1 0 - L 2 0), sq_nonneg (L 1 1 - L 2 1)]
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1966_b1
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n ≥ 3)
(L : ZMod n → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hsq : ∀ i : ZMod n, L i 0 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 ∧ L i 1 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1)
(hnoncol : ∀ i j k : ZMod n, i ≠ j ∧ j ≠ k ∧ k ≠ i → ¬Collinear ℝ {L i, L j, L k})
(hconvex : ∀ i : ZMod n, segment ℝ (L i) (L (i + 1)) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L j | j : ZMod n}) = ∅)
: ∑ i : Fin n, (dist (L i) (L (i + 1)))^2 ≤ 4 := by
  have h1 := hnoncol 0 1 2
  have h2 := hnoncol 0 2 1
  have h3 := hconvex 0
  have h4 := hconvex 1
  have h5 := hconvex 2
  have h6 := hsq 0
  have h7 := hsq 1
  have h8 := hsq 2
  norm_num at h1 h2 h3 h4 h5 h6 h7 h8
  <;>
  simp_all [Fin.sum_univ_succ, EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, Set.Icc, Set.mem_Icc,
    Set.mem_Icc, Set.mem_Icc, Set.mem_Icc]
  <;>
  nlinarith [sq_nonneg (L 0 0 - L 1 0), sq_nonneg (L 0 1 - L 1 1), sq_nonneg (L 1 0 - L 2 0),
    sq_nonneg (L 1 1 - L 2 1), sq_nonneg (L 2 0 - L 0 0), sq_nonneg (L 2 1 - L 0 1)]
```

theorem putnam_1966_b1
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n ≥ 3)
(L : ZMod n → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hsq : ∀ i : ZMod n, L i 0 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 ∧ L i 1 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1)
(hnoncol : ∀ i j k : ZMod n, i ≠ j ∧ j ≠ k ∧ k ≠ i → ¬Collinear ℝ {L i, L j, L k})
(hconvex : ∀ i : ZMod n, segment ℝ (L i) (L (i + 1)) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L j | j : ZMod n}) = ∅)
: ∑ i : Fin n, (dist (L i) (L (i + 1)))^2 ≤ 4 := by

  have h₂ := hsq 1
  have h₃ := hsq (n - 1)
  have h₄ := hnoncol 0 1 2
  have h₅ := hconvex 0
  have h₆ := hconvex 1
  have h₇ := hconvex (n - 1)

  <;> nlinarith [sq_nonneg (L 0 0 - L 1 0), sq_nonneg (L 0 1 - L 1 1), sq_nonneg (L (n-1) 0 - L 0 0), sq_nonneg (L (n-1) 1 - L 0 1)]

theorem putnam_1966_b1
(n : ℕ)
(hn : n ≥ 3)
(L : ZMod n → (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hsq : ∀ i : ZMod n, L i 0 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 ∧ L i 1 ∈ Set.Icc 0 1)
(hnoncol : ∀ i j k : ZMod n, i ≠ j ∧ j ≠ k ∧ k ≠ i → ¬Collinear ℝ {L i, L j, L k})
(hconvex : ∀ i : ZMod n, segment ℝ (L i) (L (i + 1)) ∩ interior (convexHull ℝ {L j | j : ZMod n}) = ∅)
: ∑ i : Fin n, (dist (L i) (L (i + 1)))^2 ≤ 4 := by
  have h1 := hconvex 0
  have h2 := hconvex 1
  have h3 := hconvex (n - 1)
  have h4 := hnoncol 0 1 2
  have h5 := hnoncol 0 2 1
  have h6 := hnoncol 1 0 2
  have h7 := hnoncol 1 2 0
  have h8 := hnoncol 2 0 1
  have h9 := hnoncol 2 1 0
